para.text: The well radius is the distance from the center of the well to inner edge of the well casing.
The skin radius is the distance from the center of the well to the outer edge of the skin (gravel pack or formation damage).
This is the hydraulic conductivity of the skin (gravel pack or formation damage) that surrounds the well.
If the General option is selected, the following equation is used to calculate the well loss. (h

para.text: ) The user must specify B, C, and P. A is calculated from the well radius. A value of P = 2.0 is suggested if no other data are available (the model allows 1.0
3.5). Entering a value of C = 0 will result in a “linear” model in which the value of B is entered directly (rather than entering properties of the skin, as with the SKIN option.
If the user chooses to specify the cell to well conductance directly, CWC is that conductance.
